channel.title: [GUIDE] How to change your characters appearance
channel.description:
[size=18pt]Introduction to Skins/Appearance changing[/size] Many moparscape users don't know about this besides a few so I am going to be showing you today is how to change your appearance on minecraft instead of the default skin. It's extremely easy to do so everyone can do it. This guide is going to be easy and to the point. [size=18pt]The Guide[/size] What you're going to have to do is go to this link: [url=http://www.minecraftskins.com/]Click here[/url] Download a skin you like, save it to where ever you want to save it to, preferably desktop. Then, go to the minecraft.net homepage, login to your character and go to Profile. It will now show a preview of your current skin, at the bottom click "Choose File". Find the skin you downloaded, then upload it, and it should now show your new skin.
If you don't get it, post below.

item.title: [GUIDE] How to change your characters appearance
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

If you go to your profile page it tells you exactly what to do; this tutorial isn’t much better.

I used SkinEdit to make my own Skin, if you write a tutorial for that it might be worth something:
http://www.minecraftforum.net/viewtopic.php?t=4843

Read full topic
item.source: [GUIDE] How to change your characters appearance

item.title: [GUIDE] How to change your characters appearance
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

gravenfire23:

Download the skins posted above Then go into the texture pack your using and replace the Char image with the newly downloaded skin reload your client and your skin should be changed

Except other people don’t see it…

Read full topic
item.source: [GUIDE] How to change your characters appearance

item.title: [GUIDE] How to change your characters appearance
item.dc:creator: @gravenfire23 gravenfire23
item.description:
@gravenfire23 wrote:

If you haven’t already bought mine-craft then you can do it this way (Needs you to be using a texture pack And is client sided only)

Download the skins posted above Then go into the texture pack your using and replace the Char image with the newly downloaded skin reload your client and your skin should be changed

Read full topic
